DOC.brief_title: A Media Based Motivational Intervention Prevent Alcohol Exposed Pregnancies ( AEPs )
DOC.detailed_description: The propose project evaluate effectiveness mail-based self-guided motivational intervention base Project CHOICES reduce alcohol-exposed pregnancy ( AEP ) among student non-students . Participants woman 18 44 year age risk AEP . The community target state Florida . Materials available Spanish English The intervention base investigator ' previous experience ( ) promote self-change drinking behavior community level ( b ) preventing reduce risk AEP use motivational interventional material use Project CHOICES . Using 2 group randomize design , self-guided motivational intervention compare intervention direct prevent fetal alcohol syndrome ( FAS ) . The FAS prevention condition , brochure develop CDC , serve standard treatment control group information available community level concern effect alcohol develop fetus relate FAS ( e.g. , warn label alcoholic beverage container ) . It suggest many woman , particularly college student , risk AEP view risk FAS therefore view FAS-oriented prevention message personally relevant . The proposed experimental design evaluate mail-based strategy could easily implement throughout community . The propose study design methodological rigor allow careful evaluation would possible intervention initially target entire community . The follow-up entire 6-months post-intervention.If successful , low-cost intervention readily disseminate throughout local area . Specific objective follow : 1 . Develop evidence-based intervention reduce alcohol-exposed pregnancy easily disseminate community level mail medium outlet . 2 . Implement AEP prevention intervention use randomize controlled trial woman recruit community high normal risk AEPs . 3 . Evaluate efficacy AEP prevention intervention reduce AEP risk compare community level intervention aim prevent FAS use 3 primary outcome measure previous Project CHOICES study : ( ) AEP reduce risk reduce drink effective contraception , ; ( b ) AEP reduce risk drinking ; ( c ) reduce risk effective contraception . 4 . Disseminate result study health care provider local community .
DOC.criteria: Women age 18 44 year pregnant , try become pregnant , able bear child . At risk alcohol expose pregnancy 90 day prior interview define : 1. heterosexual vaginal intercourse ineffective contraception 2. effectively use contraception 3. drinking either ≥ 8 drink per week average ≥ 5 drink single day 4. return informed consent assessment material within 60 day mail No alcohol consumption vaginal intercourse 90 day prior interview Pregnant Trying become pregnant Not able bear child Using contraception effectively
